data.title: Hanging?
data.body:
Running version 43, I get frequent hangs trying to do things like open files.

Things eventually end up giving me the prompt to force close.

![screen shot 2013-12-14 at 3 27 16 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/203/1749449/516f9f0c-6517-11e3-86dd-cb908e0f2355.png)

data.title: Replace in find/replace should respect the current casing of a word if case-sensitivity is turned
data.body:
Replace in find/replace should respect the current casing of a word if case-sensitivity is turned off (the default). If I replace "foo" with "bar", "Foo" should become "Bar".

Atom Version: 6f25945
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/6f25945 Atom-Shell/0.7.6 Safari/537.36

data.body:
Was holding down cmd-shift-t to reopen a bunch of editors.

![screen shot 2013-12-13 at 2 40 25 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/671378/1746736/ae2263c2-6447-11e3-9377-b03e895f5b38.png)

data.title: Memory leak in find and replace
data.body: I did a pretty intensive session with a lot of usage of find and replace and things started getting sluggish. Opened up the heap profiler and it looks like we're leaking span elements from the find and replace view somehow. I already discussed it with @benogle  in person.

data.title: After installing a new theme it doesn't show up in
data.body:
After installing a new theme it doesn't show up in the list in Settings until you close and open Setting again.

User: @eric
Atom Version: 0.42.0
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/0.42.0 Safari/537.36

data.title: Add heap details to status bar
data.body:
Eclipse has one of these which I always found useful to know when things are :chart_with_upwards_trend: and also when GC runs and things :chart_with_downwards_trend:

![screen shot 2013-12-13 at 10 50 37 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/671378/1745038/92188cbc-6427-11e3-8a51-ce9eae815588.png)

You can get the total/used heap via:

``` coffee
{heapUsed, heapTotal} = process.memoryUsage()
```

data.title: Add clean script
data.body: Fixes #1248

data.title: Common core commands to workspaceView
data.body: When focused on places like the tree-view and find and replace, we should be able to use a few commands like `cmd-w` and `cmd-s`. This pull moves these things to be handled in the workspaceView.

data.title: Protect from exceptions when attaching editor views w/ dead editors
data.body:
Addresses #1306

We still need to know why this is happening, so I left an exception in
non-release builds. Since the pane system is about to change a lot I
think this is good enough for now.

data.title: Make atom global a Telepath model subclass
data.body:
This PR gets rid of windowState and just makes the entire `atom` global synonymous with window state. It can be thought of as the atom "environment", and can be serialized to disk and replicated to other people. This is important because I want to move the management of all serialization into Telepath.

This is the first step in making the Atom environment something that's easy to encapsulate and instantiate anywhere. My ultimate dream, which I think isn't actually that far off, is to make it easy to instantiate an Atom model in headless specs.

data.title: Bottom tool-panels should appear above the status bar
data.body:
![find-view-spec coffee - _users_corey_github_find-and-replace](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/596/1736268/2d0e6ef6-6362-11e3-8255-edb41c41f11c.jpg)

Panels like find and replace currently appears below the status bar.

data.title: Choose already opened file even from another pane
data.body:
## Atom Version

0.43.0
## Behavior expected

Opening a file from cmd-b or cmd-p should go directly to the file if it's already opened, regardless of pane.
## Behavior observed

The file is selected if you're in the same pane, but opened new if not.
## Thoughts

This could be behavior that can be had both ways. For example, if you open a file with enter it will go to the already opened file but if you open with shift-enter it opens a new copy in the current pane.

data.title: Cycle through tabs
data.body:
## Atom Version

0.43.0
## Behavior Expected

ctrl-tab cycles through open tabs.
## Behavior Observed

ctrl-tab seems to be ignored, for the most part. I found cmd-{#} for switching to specific tabs, but it'd be nice to have a quicker way to cycle through.
### Edit

I meant ctrl-tab, not cmd-tab

What do you guys think about changing the default aliasing settings? I don't know how I feel about it myself yet, just thought it is an interesting option to consider.

data.title: Tooltip never hides
data.body:
I often find myself in a state where a tab tooltip is displayed and won't go away. The only way to make it go away is to quit Atom and reopen.

![screen shot 2013-12-12 at 8 07 04 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/123345/1732767/218c19e8-6326-11e3-8dad-1936740df24b.png)

It looks like it's due to some kind of incorrect positioning or hover detection. Here's a shot with the treeview open.

![screen shot 2013-12-12 at 8 09 32 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/123345/1732774/4b8c2b8e-6326-11e3-93ef-fa14ac9862be.png)

data.title: We're leaking Editors
data.body:
- Open an editor
- Take a heap snapshot
- Open a second editor
- Take a heap snapshot
- Close the second editor
- Take a heap snapshot

The second editor is still present in the third heap snapshot.

data.title: Upgrade grunt-download-atom-shell@0.2.1
data.body: Integrates @shama's progress bar from atom/grunt-download-atom-shell#1

data.title: Apply text to buffer via diff on reload
data.body:
Previously, it would blindly read from disk on reload, and set the text into the editor. This was problematic as it would mess with markers and folds. No longer. 

Fixes #1285 and fixes atom/bookmarks#3

data.title: Upgrade to telepath 0.70.0 for undefined marker timestamp fix
data.body:
This upgrades the serialization version of telepath documents because
for a window of time we were storing undefined timestamps. It also
adds dev-mode assertions that raise when the index of a solo marker
exceeds the array length. I think that issue should actually be resolved
and if we don't see an assertion failure here for a while we can remove
the Math.min shim.

Closes atom/telepath#7

data.title: Cursor being placed inappropriately when pressing down
data.body:
## Atom Version

0.43.0
## Behavior Expected

When pressing the down arrow while at the end of a line, the cursor should be placed at the end of the line below it.
## Behavior Observed

When pressing down at the end of the last line in a css rule or the last line of a java method, the cursor is placed before the closing } instead of after.

![before-not-after](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/152198/1729539/f2fa416c-62c2-11e3-9047-e6ad6cf7e738.gif)

data.title: Unindenting html tags
data.body:
## Atom version

0.43.0
## Behavior expected

Pressing return should have no affect on the indentation of a closing html tag that's already correctly indented.
## Behavior observed

When closing an html tag on the line below the opening tag, it is automatically indented to match the opening tag like so:

![screen shot 2013-12-11 at 3 25 53 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/152198/1729196/15dcdb56-62bc-11e3-9fdd-0c238245b283.png)

However, if you position the cursor before the closing tag and press return, the tag un-indents itself like so:

![screen shot 2013-12-11 at 3 26 00 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/152198/1729203/2fb73aee-62bc-11e3-830a-09cc9ce45ea3.png)

and the process will repeat itself until the closing tag reaches the left-edge of the buffer:

![screen shot 2013-12-11 at 3 26 05 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/152198/1729207/40beee4a-62bc-11e3-8d19-e073aead0db9.png)

data.title: Disappearing <
data.body:
Atom Version: 0.43.0

I pasted some html into a buffer that looked like this:

![screen shot 2013-12-11 at 3 00 56 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/152198/1729052/370fa3d8-62b9-11e3-8da4-98d486319669.png)

I then positioned my cursor before the first h1 tag and pressed return which removed the < before the h1 and left the html looking like so:

![screen shot 2013-12-11 at 3 01 05 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/152198/1729072/77def97c-62b9-11e3-8323-85854b852949.png)

data.title: Upgrade Telepath hoping to fix undefined timestamp exceptions
data.body: This enables a dev mode flag on Telepath when we aren't on releases to help us diagnose how markers are getting into a state where they don't have a timestamp to begin with. These won't run on official releases, and I added a null guard that should hopefully shield end users from this issue.

data.title: Make i18n support a setting
data.body:
Several keybindings are currently unusable since Mac OS X maps them to multi-keystroke accents.

Such as:
- `alt-n` followed by an `a` types an ``
- `alt-e` followed by an `e` types an ``.

This is useful if you are typing these characters but also makes the `alt-e` and `alt-n` keybindings unusable in a keymap since they generate the same key event `alt-` and you can't distinguish between two in code. Type `alt-n` in the editor with the keybindings-resolver open to see for yourself.

One possible fix for this is to set type `password` on the hidden input since these characters can't be typed into password fields in this manner and so the key events go back to "normal" and `alt-e` and `alt-n` can now be used again in keymaps.

This PR adds a preference `editor.enableI18nSupport` that toggles the hidden input between `text` and `password`.

Other ideas/approaches are welcome, this is just an initial stab at it after @benburkert reported not being able to use `alt-n` in his keymaps file.

data.title: Cannot Install the gfm Plugin
data.body:
It looks like atom is trying to install an old version of the gfm plugin.

![screen shot 2013-12-11 at 11 46 43 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/77/1727277/b803716c-629c-11e3-8636-b644059beb47.png)

data.title: Save tree view scroll position on close
data.body: What do you think about adding the ability to save the scrolled position in the tree view when Atom is closed, so when that project is reopened you are back to where you were when you closed? Currently it saves which folders were opened, which is nice, but saving the position scrolled down in the view, especially on large projects could be a nice touch.

data.title: Move by paragraph
data.body: In emacs, `forward-paragraph` and `backward-paragraph` are super handy, and in native OS X text areas, something very similar is mapped to opt-down and opt-up. This moves the cursor to the end of the current paragraph - in code (in emacs) these are delineated by newlines that are empty or only whitespace, and wrapped prose in native textareas, by newlines. Is there something like this available in Atom? If not, it might be worth adding to the platform keybindings for os x.
